description: Number of data (rows) in the corresponding Data Table (Fit, Cross or Validate)
Number of parameters (or terms) in the Current Model
Sum of squares of the residual errors
Total sum of squares
Sum of squares due to regression
Mean square error (variance of the residual errors)
Square of the multiple correlation coefficient
Adjusted R-squared - similar to Rsq, but penalizes for model complexity
Maximum of the absolute value of the residual errors
Square root of the mean square error
Skewness
Excess kurtosis
Akaike Information Criterion
Bayesian Information Criterion
F-statistic
Probability that a larger value of the F-statistic occurs by chance. This is a test of overall model fitness.
Estimated standard error of the skewness. If SKEW > 2*s.e.SKEW, there is evidence that residual errors are not normally distributed.
Estimated standard error of the kurtosis. If |ExKurt|> 2*s.e.ExKurt, there is evidence that residual errors are not normally distributed.
The t-statistic used to determine how significant this term is. A value above about 2.0 is usually considered significant.
The probability that this term occurs by chance. Cell is colored green if p(t) > alpha (default alpha = 0.05).
